bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: Pathological Condition of ju 疽 , impediment-illness, which emerges because a body’s yang qi is weak and hence has no strength to ward off evil qi. In general, the affected region is not hot, and the pain is comparatively mild. The color is pale, and the surface issunken in. However, the patient’s mind is disturbed, and his condition is serious. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry ya chi 牙齒 quotes Ren zhai zhi zhi fang 仁齋直指方 : 陰疽不發：頭凹沉黯，不疼無熱，服 內補散不起 , “Before a yin impediment-illness has emerged, its head is sunken in and of a pale color. There is neither pain nor heat. If one ingests a powder for internal supplementation, [the impediment] will not rise”.
